title: How to Track Inventory and Supplies
description: Never run out mid-job again. Set up simple inventory tracking that saves trips and time.
requirements: Knowledge of what supplies you use regularly
15 minutes to take stock of what you have

steps.title: List your critical supplies
steps.description: Identify items you can't do jobs without.
substeps: Think about what you use on every job
List items that would stop a job if you ran out
Include consumables (filters, fittings, paint, etc.)
Note where you typically buy each item
steps.tip: Start with 10-15 items. Don't try to track everything at first.

steps.title: Choose a tracking method
steps.description: Pick something simple you'll actually use.
substeps: Simplest: A note on your phone with item and quantity
Better: Google Sheets with items, quantities, and reorder points
Best: An app like Sortly (free tier) or Inventory Now
Jobber/HouseCall Pro users: Use the built-in inventory feature

steps.title: Do a quick inventory count
steps.description: Figure out what you currently have.
substeps: Walk through your truck and shop
Count each item on your list
Enter the counts into your tracking system
Note any items that are low

steps.title: Set reorder points
steps.description: Decide when to restock each item.
substeps: For each item: How many do you use per week?
Set reorder point at 2 weeks worth of inventory
Example: Use 5 filters/week → Reorder when you hit 10
Consider lead time for items that take a while to get
steps.tip: When in doubt, err on the side of having more. Running out costs more than storage.

steps.title: Create a weekly check routine
steps.description: Inventory only works if you keep it updated.
substeps: Pick a day (Sunday evening or Monday morning)
Walk through and update counts
Check items against reorder points
Place orders for anything that's low
5-10 minutes saves hours of emergency runs

successMessage: You now have an inventory system! No more running to the supply house mid-job.
proTips: Keep a small 'emergency kit' with common items in your truck even beyond your main inventory
Track what you use per job to improve your estimates
Some suppliers offer auto-replenishment programs — worth asking about
